website_summaries.verdict: Uses only organic and human-grade ingredients for a safe dog-treat recipe.
pros: All ingredients and manufacturing occur in the U.S., so you can trust the quality
Contains no grains as fillers, which is good for dogs with allergies
The bite-sized snacks are perfect to use as training rewards or occasional treats
cons: Occasional packaging control issues and problems with freshness

customer_reviews.title: Moldy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these treats at the end of June 2018. Finally got around to opening them and they are covered in mold! Said it is good until May 2020. Not impressed!
customer_reviews.author: FedorFamily

customer_reviews.title: Check for mold!
customer_reviews.text: The expiration date on our bag says November 28, 2019 but these arrived visibly covered in mold. Make sure to check for mold before feeding to your beloved pet!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Ingredients have changed
customer_reviews.text: Watch out- the ingredients listed on amazon do not match the ingredients on the package. It contains milk. Organic dried skim milk is listed as one of the ingredients. Be careful if your dog has a milk allergy like mine!
customer_reviews.author: Momofthree

customer_reviews.title: Picky Eater Approved!
customer_reviews.text: Auggie ‘the Doggie’, a Cairn/French Bulldog mix, has an exceedingly sophisticated palate! I think it developed over time as he consumed a variety of ‘soils and the accompanying fungi’ from our yard! While he is not exactly picky about ‘what’ he will eat....he is very particular about the ‘food’ he eats. Crazy, I know:). He has sampled everything (soft & smaller sized...as it’s the only ‘food treats’ he will try) available at the local grocery stores. I found ONE he absolutely loves....this is it! And I love that it’s human grade quality!! Best price I’ve found is this add-on item.
customer_reviews.author: Bebe

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Ingredients!!! Highly Recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is not picky - so he loves this just like he loves every dog snack I have ever given him. As I learn more and more about dog food ingredients and struggle to keep up with safe vs. unsafe ingredients, I find that I am thrilled with the ingredients for this product!!!! Highly Recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Panda BearTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My puppy couldn’t chew them
customer_reviews.text: These treats were in possible for my 10 week old Shih Tzu puppy to eat. There is an outside skin, like you would find on a sausage, that made it impossible for her to chew. The point of training treats is that they eat them quickly and return to the lesson, but she would take the treat and run off to try to eat it. I got another brand that worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Beware the 2nd Ingredient is SUGAR!
customer_reviews.text: These are loaded with sugar and not good for dogs. They upset my dog's stomach and gave him diarrhea!
customer_reviews.author: The Technology Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Yummy & safe
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy has a very sensitive tummy and it's the only treat we can give him without him getting a belly ache. We don't over do it, meaning about 5 pieces a day top. He loves them and they work great for training treats!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our go-to training treats!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two bags of the duck treats and just put them in a mason jar for easier storage. They came in perfect condition, and very moist. My pup LOVES these treats, and honestly I even think they smell good! We’ve been using them for training and he’ll do any of his tricks for one. I also feel very good knowing they have clean ingredients. This is our new go-to treat for training
customer_reviews.author: Caitlynn Burns

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: These are great. My dog loves them and they are the perfect size for training. The only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is that they will go moldy if you don't use them fast enough. I actually like that as it means this is real food, but it is important to keep in mind when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly G.

customer_reviews.title: Meat. From China do it feed
customer_reviews.text: The meat is from CHINA do not feed this to your dog!
customer_reviews.author: Songpeddlar

customer_reviews.title: Favorite trainer for puppy
customer_reviews.text: Tiny tidbits but very effective at getting puppy's attention. She can tell if there are more in my pocket and is extremely attentive to earn one more. They are healthy and don't ruin her appetite.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My 3 dogs absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first purchase to try it out with my 3 dogs. (Biewer Terrier, Havanese and Maltese) They totally love it and no problem with their sensitive stomach.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Dog liked it but diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: My dog fully enjoy these treats, the only problem is I did give her diarrhea. And I think that may have been because her stomach is not used to the streets. So I would recommend cutting them into smaller pieces and incorporating them in there every day food/diet so that their tummy can get used to it at first. Then you can start using it as a treat reward.
customer_reviews.author: Selene Lariba

customer_reviews.title: My Chi LOVES These
customer_reviews.text: My extremely picky chihuahua absolutely loves these and the ONLY other treat he will eat is the Core ones; he actually turns his head away in disdain of the many, many others I have tried to give him. When I hold out one of each in my hands for him to choose he always picks the Full Moon treat first. These are a fairly soft treat and petite. Love that they are human grade and actually at a cheaper price than the Core ones, changing my Subscribe and Save to these now. Very, very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Desi

customer_reviews.title: Human purchased, mutt approved.
customer_reviews.text: So, I’m rating the flavor based on my dogs excitement when they see or hear the package. Full disclosure, I did not actually taste the treats. These are great ‘training’ treats. By training I mean trying to get my dog to do things that they really know how to do at this point, but just seem to sometimes lack motivation. They are small pieces. About the size of a piece of dog food. My dogs have yet to complain about the portion size though. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly O'Neil

customer_reviews.title: The power of three out of three
customer_reviews.text: It's just a matter of different tastes, but my three dogs (who love the taste of duck) took a few sniffs of this treat, turned their heads as if to say "yuck," and walked away. The treats have a strong smoky odor which some dogs (like mine) dislike. I've always suspected smoke flavor is added to mask an underlying bad taste, but whatever the reason, the two packets of Full Moon treats I bought was a big waste of money in my case.
customer_reviews.author: BeautifulMichigan

customer_reviews.title: SUPER High-Value Treat
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a shelf-stable treat that would be smelly & delicious enough to draw my reactive dog's attention when we're working on counter-conditioning. These have been perfect. They are a bit greasy (kind of to be expected when you want a really potent treat), but my dog adores them and they've been a huge asset to her training. Very much worth the price if you're working on reactivity and need an extra high-value treat.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: These treats smell amazing, but the dog is indifferent
customer_reviews.text: I wish the dog was as interested in the treats as I am. They smell wonderful and taste good too (yes I tried one). But somehow the dog just wants to lick them for several minutes, then eventually eat them. So not great for training from my experience, because of the lack of motivation from the dog. Also, they are very greasy. So they leave an oily film on everything. I have been tediously washing whatever surface they touch. I was really hoping for more. Though, it seems others have had better luck.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Products

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but oh so tasty . . .
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these treats --- he's a small dog so even though these are really tiny, he enjoys them a lot. I did not realize that they are "training" treats so are very small (dime size) and had thought they'd be more like the Zuke's Minis or the Merrick Power Bites but pooch loves 'em so all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Replay888

customer_reviews.title: Great treats and the perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Over the 5 years that we've had our pup, we have tried dozens of different treats and these ones take the cake. Not only does our lab/collie-mix go crazy for these treats but they're the perfect size for training or grabbing a handful for a long dog walk. As long as you don't mind the "natural" smell they store well - we usually buy two bags at once and even after a month or two in our plastic jar they haven't dried up or molded. They do use sugar cane which is why I have the ingredients 4/5, but everything else is organic and/or natural.
customer_reviews.author: adecarolis

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs Go Nuts For This!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs absolutely love these ducks treats! They can smell them a mile away. I love that the ingredients are just duck, all natural and grain free. I love that it's 100% USA sourced. Their bite size, and chewy, not hard and it's not a jerky that will splinter and get stuck on the inside, like their intestines or throat. I trust Full Moon Duck Treats and feel great giving them to my "fur-babies"!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca J Holyfield

customer_reviews.title: Cocoa LOVES these!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as something to fill a treat ball with since they are smaller and I'm assuming a little lower cal than regular treats might be and Cocoa LOVES them. He attacks his treat ball with more fervor than ever before and plays until he's gotten all the treats out, which he doesn't always do. The ingredients are top notch, and I'm not going to lie, my bf may or may not have tried one of them after looking at the ingredients and said they were pretty tasty, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Molly

customer_reviews.title: My dog is obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is obsessed with these, he literally hits me for more. I love that they are good quality and human grade. They smell great and are cut in fairly small pieces which is great for my 10 pound morkie. He loves them so much I now have this on subscription!
customer_reviews.author: Einafets7

customer_reviews.title: Perfect training tool to fit in the pocket
customer_reviews.text: The dog is undergoing training for search and rescue and has a high drive and focus. These are a nice safe treat for my dog to enjoy as a reward for a job well done. Organic is the way to go. Think about it years ago dogs didnt have manufactured kibble and the chemical / by-products are gross. If you won't eat it why would you give it to your best friend who adores you.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great mini treats
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Work so well. My dachshund is food motivated so I can cut these in half and he can have quite a few without gaining weight. They stay moist in package as long as you properly close them. My furbaby loves them.
customer_reviews.author: joann m caban

customer_reviews.title: Pup loves them and much less mess
customer_reviews.text: My puppy has loved these from the moment we tried them. An excellent high value treat for us because of that. Furthermore, we always cut our treats into even smaller pieces and that usually yields a lot of crumbs but not so with these - no crumbs! they're kind of like mini salami or pepperoni in terms of texture and the ingredients seem to be excellent.
customer_reviews.author: ArtVandelay

customer_reviews.title: Great soft treat for older dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have two 15 year old Jack Russell Terrier's and they both love these little treats. The treats are small and soft so they each get about 5 treats at a time. I also recommend Full Moon All Natural Human Grade Dog Treats, Chicken Nuggets. Again, these are also soft and easy for them to eat. So far I'm very happy with this company and their products.
customer_reviews.author: Chuter

customer_reviews.title: Great for Training!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to help as an incentive for my pups potty training(really any training)..they are a perfect tiny bite and the dogs LOVE them..and because they love them they really work for them...I have 10 week old Rot puppies and they currently sit/lay down/stop barking/get down after jumping all for these treats! We do an hour of training every day, and I am still not through the bag..its great!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Best treat for your dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have bought so many treats for my dog and for some reason she always reacts to it. She’ll have puke and have diarrhea. But ever since i switched to this treat, she has no problem and its definitely a great treat for training. She gets so excited over this treat and i love how the price is not too expensive. Ive made 5 purchases so far and will continue to purchase more from this brand
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: If you want your dog to have diarrhea, these are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I buy Full Moon products all the time and never had a problem, until I bought these from Amazon. I’m not sure if the company gives a certain amount to facilities and let them sit there until they are ordered. However, my dog had severe diarrhea and vomiting for two days straight after eating these treats. I know this because she didn’t have anything else or unusual. They were not expired, but as you can see in these reviews, they are not exactly truthful with the expiration dates. In other words, DO NOT BUY THESE UNLESS YOU WANT TO CLEAN DOG DIARRHEA FOR 2 DAYS STRAIGHT!!!
customer_reviews.author: ZE

customer_reviews.title: My Dog can't chew these
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if the batch I got is old and dried out or what the problem is with these. My dog is a 5 month old pug with pretty sharp teeth and she takes about 2 minutes to chew one of these and even then sometimes spits it out. I have to tear them into tiny pieces so she can just swallow them if I'm going to use them. Not ideal at all for training. Even tearing them apart with my fingers can be difficult since the outside of them is a hard, almost plastic like skin.
customer_reviews.author: G. Tomascheski

customer_reviews.title: Loved by a picky eater
customer_reviews.text: I have a rescue dog who was mistreated by a breeder and is not motivated by treats, which makes training difficult, but he LOVES these. I'm so glad I found them. The ingredients are good quality, they're small so I can give him several and not worry about him getting chubby and they're really helping me teach him how to behave in the real world.
customer_reviews.author: Denver

customer_reviews.title: Good Training Treats
customer_reviews.text: I like these as training treats because they're small. I used to cut up hot dogs to use as training treats, but to be honest I'm lazy and it's easier to just buy treats that are already the right size. My dog likes them. The only thing I don't love is they make her fart a lot, and her farts smell like greens (from this treat).
customer_reviews.author: Greta

customer_reviews.title: My dog normally loves Full Moon treats, but won't eat these
customer_reviews.text: My dog smelled these and wouldn't even try them. I put in his mouth and he spit it out. I've bought him duck wet food, dry food, and small training treats (because I know he loves duck). But these, he won't even try. He normally loves this company's treats, but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Animal Lover

customer_reviews.title: great for crate-training
customer_reviews.text: My Westie absolutely loves these, especially the duck variety. When it's time for him to spend time in his crate, I get three of these little gems, go "Kennel, kennel kennel," and he gallops in and relishes them. In other words, great for crate-training.
customer_reviews.author: Anahita

customer_reviews.title: Paws up, tail wagging treat!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these treats. I keep them on hand for my smaller dog clients (dog sitter) who can’t chew on bully sticks or bits. I break the treat in half for the smaller dogs. This way they are chewing almost as long or longer, like the other pups who are enjoying the bully sticks/bits and don’t feel left out.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Texas in VA

customer_reviews.title: My dogs LOVE these treats and it makes training so much easier
customer_reviews.text: Love the organic natural ingredients and dont have to feel bad about feeding these to my girls. Also they love these more than any other treat weve tried so win win!! Buy these your dog will thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dogs favorite!
customer_reviews.text: I have one picky dog Nugget on the left end and even he loves these! The other two (Chicken and Gumbo) are not as picky and they realllyyy love these! Love all the different varieties of the Full Moon brand. These are my go to at this point! The dogs will do anything for them! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Shack

customer_reviews.title: Puppy treats
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loves these and made with all natural ingredients
customer_reviews.author: kimberly

customer_reviews.title: DOG LOVES THEM
customer_reviews.text: These dog treats are great for training, my dog seems to love them. They are tiny so if you have a large dog they might be disappointed but my Jack Russell loves them. As for the flavor even though they are human grade I would never eat them. Again, the dog is happy therefore I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Great for training and even breaking into smaller pieces!
customer_reviews.text: Moist and a weird protein! Best combo for training treats and addressing dogs with allergies to the basic proteins. Goes a long way especially if you break it up and is locally sourced! A bit pricey but it's great for a high reward. I would try if your pup isn't taking to other treats or needs more motivation for harder training sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality treats
customer_reviews.text: First off, these treats are hard! Very reminiscent of the eraser of a Ticonderoga pencil.and they aren’t even expired! Secondly, I dont know what is in them, but they make my dog throw up. Every time he has one, he pukes the next morning. Do not purchase these treats!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Doberman likes it
customer_reviews.text: Ringo, my dog, does like them but is not crazy about them. As a treat they are ok but they seem not tastey enough as training motivation.
customer_reviews.author: Las Vegas Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect training treats
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs love these we have a small and medium dog and they both love these. They have been great for potty training and teaching new tricks. I have bought them 3 times at least and will continue to get them !!
customer_reviews.author: FlashySmile

customer_reviews.title: Dry and crumbly?! Don’t purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: When I first started getting these for my picky girl, we were both thrilled. But the last several bags contained dry, crumbly, icky, weird treats. Completely different product. ??? The seller clearly isn’t concerned about the safety of our fur babies. I’ve found some my finicky girl is loving!! Merrick treats. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: A Treat for my little senior
customer_reviews.text: My little senior pup (13 yrs) has few teeth & cannot chew crunchy things or jerky texture things. These little treats are perfect for her as they are quite flavorful & soft enough for her to chew. Size is perfect for her as she is a tiny dog :) Will purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase!
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible. Not soft but little rubber discs. My 8 week old Aussie couldn't chew and almost chocked before I got one out of her mouth. Horrible product.
customer_reviews.author: E. White

customer_reviews.title: Makes dog gassy & itchy but she loves the flavor
customer_reviews.text: This product my dog loves it but it gives her thee worst gas & it seems to make her quite itchy. Probably allergic to something in it.
customer_reviews.author: Stella Ka’uhane

customer_reviews.title: Great quality & economical
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these treats, and they aren't overly priced like other brands. I ususally smell any treats as many are odorless (I know dogs' tastebuds are different), although these smell almost appetizing so I would assume any dog would like them a lot! My husky does tricks whenever he sees me reaching for the bag.
customer_reviews.author: J C

customer_reviews.title: Grew on my pups rather quickly - 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: My two pups (mini poodle and toy terrier) tend to be on the pickier side. They of course refused these, then came back with curiosity. Now all i have to do is shake the bag and they come running for them and cant get enough. I LIKE that it is human grade. These are great for training - excellent motivator treat. I do recommend and will be buying again :) Ace from NY
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: My picky dog LOVES these treats
customer_reviews.text: My dog is very picky and has a lot of allergies as well. I was absolutely shocked to see how much he likes these treats. More often than not, I end up donating, giving away or throwing out treats and food because he won’t touch them. Really happy to find something he loves.
customer_reviews.author: WFTLI

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket training treats
customer_reviews.text: I carry treats with me when I walk our two dogs. These are the perfect size, and are non-crumbly. The fact that the ingredients are human grade and they are overall low calorie make them a great option for training. The dogs love them, so my guess is the flavor/smell must be great for them too.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Good product made in usa
customer_reviews.text: My dog is very picky about his treats. I finally found these treats that he likes. I cut each treat into 3’s because they are a bit expensive. I wish the company would make some sample packages so their other treats can be sampled.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Jordan

customer_reviews.title: My dog only likes these.
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy Amazon has these again. I bought the duck ones last time as the chicken wasn't available. The duck made my little dog sick. I was afraid they were discontinued. She is 11 and has dental issues. These are small and soft. She loves them. She knows where the bag is and barks at them. I think I may put on subscribe and save just in case.
customer_reviews.author: casey weiss

customer_reviews.title: Dogs inhale these
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for potty training treats for a very small puppy. My other 2 adult dogs go nuts for them too. They are like slices of a small beef stick. Perfect for a small mouth and for any of my dogs apparantly. I will be getting more.
customer_reviews.author: Quincey Y.

customer_reviews.title: Gets Piper's Attention
customer_reviews.text: The quality seems good, but sometimes treats seem kinda over-done, over-cooked??? Piper prefers the Duck Treats, but these will get her attention and that's what I'm going for...Decent product, as do the Ducks, it seem rather highly priced.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price
customer_reviews.text: My picky 3 year dog loves it! She is so picky with everything that she eats but surprisingly, she took to these well. She only likes Pupperoni treats. Not only are the ingredients amazing but she loves them too. They are kind of big (in my opinion) for a 6lb dog but they can be ripped into smaller pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Will  ever buy again !
customer_reviews.text: Got these a day or two ago , my healthy dog had as a treat about 4 during the day . Last night she had 2 seizures never had one before . Had to take her to emergency vet . I am scared will throw away two packs I bought .
customer_reviews.author: i TiffySullivan

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Treats
customer_reviews.text: These limited ingredient treats are high quality and our pups love them! They do smell very strong and are kind of pricey for a small bag but the pups come running for them! I buy this brand for a special treat for them now, not every week like some of the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: CrazyDogLadyx3Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Product bad. Disintegrates to a powder in your hand.
customer_reviews.text: Product appears to be old or maybe was in the heat a long time. Just disintegrates in your hand when you pick a piece up. Not going to risk giving it to my dogs. Does not look like what I normally get when I buy this brand/product.
customer_reviews.author: rw75068

customer_reviews.title: Our puppy approves!
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy loves these and they are not too hard for his little teeth. Nice size for training.
customer_reviews.author: i.heart.books

customer_reviews.title: Natural and good but a tad expensive
customer_reviews.text: I'd like how these treats are all natural and organic. Also comes in an okay size bag but like I've mentioned in many of my pet reviews about natural products they are getting very expensive nowadays. I use these every once in awhile but still not cheaper than getting string cheese and hot dogs at the supermarket.
customer_reviews.author: Erin B.

customer_reviews.title: Dog’s love ‘em!
customer_reviews.text: I am a security guard at a pet-friendly apartment building. I give the treats to resident’s dogs as they pass through the lobby. Even the finicky dogs who turn their noses up at other treats gobble these down! I purchased the product because it is organic. I consider it a good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Al

customer_reviews.title: Puppy Loves These
customer_reviews.text: They are the perfect size for training or just a treat. My poodle mix puppy absolutely loves these...more than any other treat she has tried (and she's spoiled, so she has had quite the variety). They are soft and honestly smell and look like gourmet SlimJim slices. They are a great value too at $$ to $$$. Since they don't have preservatives and some previous reviews complained about spoiling/mold, I keep them in the fridge, but it's likely not necessary. Stock up on these when the price is good!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Grasso

customer_reviews.title: Great training treats
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these. They are a great training treat and are very moist. They do dry out fast to reseal the back immediately! I have bought about 4 bags of these and will keep buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: My dog says they are delicious.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love them. I was buying a larger treat and cutting them up, but that got tideous. I still cut these in half if I want to make it stretch for dedicated training sessions, but much easier to cut these in half than to cut larger ones in quarters.
customer_reviews.author: arsallotTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Organic non -GMO.  What more can you ask for !!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. My yorkie loves them last Sat she woke me to go out at 6am. Then 7am. Then 745 and I started to wonder if she had upset tummy. Then she wanted out at 830 and I suddenly realized why. I was giving one of these as a treat to her each time lol
customer_reviews.author: Patti Foley

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Apparently these are disgusting because my treat loving Yorkie will not eat these for anything. She loves treats, these seem so healthy, but they must taste horrible. I hate wasting money .
customer_reviews.author: Kitena Suttles

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these. They love all of the treats by this company. Bit expensive but that’s because it’s high quality. It’s worth spending the extra money to give my doggos healthy tasty treats
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love these !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use these as only an every once in awhile treat . I have three dogs and these are on the high price side for me . I keep them in the fridge . The excitement when I get these out is really funny . My largest and most gentle dog gets a little too aggressive when being given these ! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Dog Sense

customer_reviews.title: Dogs ♥️ These Treats
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my Pet Chatz unit (interactive dog camera system & treat dispenser). They are small round pieces like if you cut up a Slim Jim. I needed a small round treat to fit the dispenser and these were the only ones that didn’t contain the ingredients that one of my dogs is highly allergic to (chicken, beef, potatoes, flour, pea flour, etc). They smell yummy, dogs ♥️ them, and they’re made in USA with better stuff than most treats out there.
customer_reviews.author: Puppy Freak

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for training puppies!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for training! They are very small pieces so your doggies don't stuff too much from treats from repetitive training. High quality treats that you don't have to worry about synthetic ingredients and fillers. Price is affordable and doggies love them!
customer_reviews.author: Kay M

customer_reviews.title: Dog treats
customer_reviews.text: My dog has allergies. These dog treats are made with duck which is the protein she is able to tolerate. She loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tasty, Small Treats
customer_reviews.text: The duck was liked by my dog. The treats we're way too small. This was my error in ordering them, thinking they were equal in helping size as the other Full Moon Treats.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Soft treats. Great for small dogs and/or training.
customer_reviews.text: I find myself buying "training treats" for our small dogs because regular size treats are too big or too many calories. I love that these are soft so they can eat them quickly. I find they don't travel too well, 'cause they're a little crumbly. We serve these at home.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Shipley

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves them.
customer_reviews.text: Simba is a very picky eater so I have to use treats to entice him to eat, and these were perfect. I cut them in even smaller pieces and sprinkle them over his food and bam, he’s eating.
customer_reviews.author: GSDMOM

customer_reviews.title: Good treats, unevenly sized
customer_reviews.text: My dogs really like these training treats. However, they are unevenly cut - some are a lot thicker and larger than others, others are halved. You never know what you get when you reach into the bag. I am sure there is a way to remedy that.
customer_reviews.author: Margo

customer_reviews.title: The best treats for training
customer_reviews.text: My puppy as well as my older dog loves these treats. My puppy would do anything for them and it made training a lot easier. Label on package says over 175+ treats and I believe it. I would highly reccomend this product if you are training a puppy. These are also organic which is another reason why I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D

customer_reviews.title: Good for training!!
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves these!! I think they are perfect size for training that way you can train the same trick over and over without feeling like you are giving too many treats!!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves em
customer_reviews.text: They definitely look like a cut up chicken sausage. Dog loves these. We mix up the treats used during training and these are definitely one of the good ones.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great Motivators!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only treat that motivates both dogs. They will do anything for these and that has really helped me train some new behaviors. I have these on subscribe and save. For my 10lb dog, I pinch these in half and she is still just as excited.
customer_reviews.author: Jenshuttle

customer_reviews.title: Our Yorkie Loves these
customer_reviews.text: We cant find in the store so we were very happy when we found them here. Our Yorkie is very picky. He loves these. Will purchase them here from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Made with sugar
customer_reviews.text: Color me stupid. Made with sugar! Had NO idea they'd put sugar into a dog treat. I'm afraid all I read was "organic chicken" and I assumed everything else would be in line with how I'm feeding my dog. alas, no! Am returning these. My dog is eating only raw and this sure doesn't fit the bill. Caveat emptor!
customer_reviews.author: Angela A.

customer_reviews.title: There are perfect! Great ingredients
customer_reviews.text: There are perfect! Great ingredients, perfect size, my 10 pound chihuahua loves these and they make training a breeze. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: A healthier treat option.
customer_reviews.text: These are one of the few treats we feed our dog because the have real ingredients and use rosemary as a preservitive. They also come in a very small portion which is very good for training and rewards . Hard to find in our area.
customer_reviews.author: katherine therrien

customer_reviews.title: High-value treats for training.
customer_reviews.text: My dog (mountain cur mix) really seems to respond to these. And she seems rather picky as a puppy. They're soft. Have a strong scent but it's not offensive to a couple of human plant-based eaters. We've bought a dozen different, high quality, grain free treats for training. She doesn't care for a third of them. This is in her top three high value treats.
customer_reviews.author: Kerre J. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch received
customer_reviews.text: I always order this Brand and some how the last one I ordered was spoiled within 2 days which never happens. It seems like this was a bad batch.
customer_reviews.author: CHANDANI ARORA

customer_reviews.title: Try them!
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy loves these, and they are perfect for training. If you’re looking for a good quality, organic treat, definitely try these. We have them on auto ship!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Costello

customer_reviews.title: Good quality training treat
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs and they both love these. They smell okay, and look pretty good also. The ingredients seem to be of good quality, and neither dog had a problem tolerating.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good but Small Bag
customer_reviews.text: Great, but the bag is small. I ended up getting Zuke's minis after buying this once because it comes in bigger sizes and I have multiple dogs.
customer_reviews.author: David Z.

customer_reviews.title: Were moldy!!
customer_reviews.text: I had to throw the entire bag away. I keep my home cool so there is no reason these should have had white fuzz all over them! Would not buy again. Totally disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: JVS

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best treats for small dogs. They contain excellent ingredients and are the perfect size for my small dog. A great product-Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: Deb A

customer_reviews.title: Puppy won't eat them
customer_reviews.text: My puppy won't touch them, he'd rather eat anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Meg77

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves them
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves them. They are nice n small so I figure they don’t have a lot of calories. I didn’t actually taste them but she loves them. I just use them as treats, not for training. But they’d be perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Pensabene

customer_reviews.title: Great training treats.
customer_reviews.text: Both the dog and cat prefer these treats over all others. They are little sliced chicken sausages, moist and fresh. Very good for training.
customer_reviews.author: M.W.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult for small breeds to chew
customer_reviews.text: The texture of these is like beef jerky. This would be fine for bigger sized puppies. But if you have a small breed puppy, they are difficult for them to chew. Maybe we got a bad batch and they are supposed to be softer? Not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Dogs eat them
customer_reviews.text: These are not my usual dog treats but they will work. The size of the treat is very inconsistent that’s why I only gave them 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: resqchick

customer_reviews.title: My dog's favorite treat!
customer_reviews.text: My dog goes more nuts for these than ANY other treat! We have tried about 10 different brands and flavors and these work best.
customer_reviews.author: Shalome

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves  them
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves them and also the chicken nuggets from the same company. I like the limited ingredients and made in the usa.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Fowler

product_meta.title: Full Moon Organic Human Grade Training Treats for Dogs
product_meta.description:
Flavor Name:Chicken Training Treats| Size:6.0 ounceFinally, a training treat that will have YOU licking your fingers! Made with real organic chicken and 100% human grade ingredietns, each tasty bite bursts with a flavor your dog will roll over for. Or sit. Or stay. At less than 3 calories per treat, the possibilites are endless! 

Directions: 
Recommended feeding amounts are based on your dogs weight. be sure to provide plenty of fresh drinking water while feeding. Pieces per Day by Dog Weight: 5-15lbs ½ - 2 treats; 15 - 30lbs 2 - 4 treats; 30-50lbs 4 - 6 treats; 50-75+lbs 6 - 8 treats
feature_bullets: Human Grade Dog Treats Made In The Usa
Under 3 Calories Per Treat, Great For Training
Glycerin Free And Grain Free - No Corn, Wheat Or Soy
All Natural, No Artificial Flavors, Preservatives, Or Colors
